greyshed.lib

Class Quaternion

  • java.lang.Object
    • greyshed.lib.Quaternion

  • public class Quaternion
extends java.lang.Object
    Store, convert, and modify orientation information in Quaternion notation. Provides options for creating orientations from reference points, and converting to and from PMatrix and Axis Angle (UR Robots) notation.
    +Example
    import greyshed.lib.*; //import the library

ShapeMethods sm;

PVector pt = new PVector(20,20);
PVector center;

void setup() {
  size(200,200);
  sm = new ShapeMethods(this);
  center = new PVector(width/2,height/2);
}

void draw() {
  background(0);
  PVector rotatedPt = sm.rotatePoint(pt, center, PI);
  strokeWeight(10);
  stroke(255,0,0);
  point(rotatedPt.x,rotatedPt.y);
}

      • fromFrame

        public void fromFrame(PVector xV,
                      PVector yV,
                      PVector zV)
        Create a new quaternion given the x,y,z vectors of a target frame.

        Using these frame vectors, calculate the quaternion. See euclideanspace

        Parameters:
        xV - plane X Axis direction vector
        yV - plane Y Axis direction vector
        zV - plane Z Axis direction vector

      • toOrientString

        public java.lang.String toOrientString()
        Returns:
        the quaternion as a string, enclosed in square brackets, comma delineated, and truncated to 6 decimal places.
